memberdef.argsstring: (int nitems, size_t sizeof_item, uint64_t downstream_lcm_nitems, block_sptr link)
memberdef.name: make_buffer

memberdef.argsstring: (buffer_sptr buf, int nzero_preload, block_sptr link, int delay)
memberdef.name: buffer_add_reader

briefdescription.para: Create a new gr::buffer_reader and attach it to buffer buf.

parameterdescription.para: is the buffer the gr::buffer_reader reads from.
number of zero items to "preload" into buffer.
is the block that reads from the buffer using this gr::buffer_reader.
Optional setting to declare the buffer's sample delay.

briefdescription.para: return the buffer's mapping type
return number of items worth of space available for writing
return size of this buffer in items
return the base address of the buffer
return pointer to write buffer.

detaileddescription.para: The return value points at space that can hold at least space_available() items.

briefdescription.para: return pointer to read buffer.

detaileddescription.para: The return value points to at least items_available() items.

briefdescription.para: tell buffer that we wrote nitems into it
Return the block that writes to this buffer.
Adds a new tag to the buffer.
Removes an existing tag from the buffer.

detaileddescription.para: If no such tag is found, does nothing. Note: Doesn't actually physically delete the tag, but marks it as deleted. For the user, this has the same effect: Any subsequent calls to get_tags_in_range() will not return the tag.

parameterdescription.para: the tag that needs to be removed
the unique ID of the block calling this function

briefdescription.para: Removes all tags before max_time from buffer.

parameterdescription.para: the time (item number) to trim up until.

briefdescription.para: Function to be executed after this object's owner completes the call to general_work()
Returns true when the current thread is ready to call the callback, false otherwise. Note if input_blocked_callback is overridden then this function should also be overridden.
Callback function that the scheduler will call when it determines that the input is blocked. Override this function if needed.
Returns true if the current thread is ready to execute output_blocked_callback(), false otherwise. Note if the default output_blocked_callback is overridden this function should also be overridden.
Callback function that the scheduler will call when it determines that the output is blocked. Override this function if needed.
Increment the number of active pointers for this buffer.
Decrement the number of active pointers for this buffer and signal anyone waiting when the count reaches zero.
"on_lock" function from the custom_lock_if.
"on_unlock" function from the custom_lock_if.
Assign buffer's transfer_type.
Increment read or write index for this buffer.
Decrement read or write index for this buffer.

memberdef.argsstring: (buffer_mapping_type buftype, int nitems, size_t sizeof_item, uint64_t downstream_lcm_nitems, uint32_t downstream_max_out_mult, block_sptr link)
memberdef.name: buffer

briefdescription.para: constructor is private. Use gr_make_buffer to create instances.

detaileddescription.para: Allocate a buffer that holds at least nitems of size sizeof_item.

buftype
is an enum type that describes the buffer TODO: fix me
nitems
is the minimum number of items the buffer will hold.
sizeof_item
is the size of an item in bytes.
downstream_lcm_nitems
is the least common multiple of the items to read by downstream block(s)
downstream_max_out_mult
is the maximum output multiple of all downstream blocks
link
is the block that writes to this buffer.
The total size of the buffer will be rounded up to a system dependent boundary. This is typically the system page size, but under MS windows is 64KB.

briefdescription.para: disassociate reader from this buffer
Single writer, multiple reader fifo.
